name: John Doe
profile: A University of Leeds graduate student who is enrolled in the Data Science and Analysis programme. Dedicated to software engineering, having two or more years of expertise, and specialising in full‑stack web development, algorithms, and machine learning. Searching mostly for Machine Learning, Data Engineer, and Python Development positions.

education.title: University of Leeds
education.description: MSc in Data Science and Analysis

bulletPoints.text: Head of School International Excellence Scholar
Working as a PAL Mentor

Data Science, Programming for Data Science, Knowledge Representation and Reasoning, Statistical Theory and Methods, LearningSkills through Case Studies, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Statistical Learning

education.title: Madhav Institute of Technology and Science

bulletPoints.text: Graduated with Distinction
Selected for Industrial Visit among the top of the class
Passed with Distinction
Specialised in Physics, Chemistry, and Maths with Computer Science
Collaborated with a four‑person team to develop a CNN model that utilised YOLO as a foundation to improve the accuracy of ambient lighting conditions in the Mobile net architecture.
Automated and optimised the data handling process for traffic signs, working with Ubuntu 20.04 did shell scripting, and employed other Linuxtools.
Significantly boosted the model’s accuracy by 60%, which was yielding an accuracy of 70‑78% under Indian street light. The older models, had an accuracy of 10‑15%.
Python with PyTorch, NumPy, Matplotlib, Pandas, Scikit‑learn, C++, Ubuntu Linux, Linux tools, Apt, Scripting, Git.
Teamwork, Time Management, Communication, Presentation skills.

projects.title: The Relation between GDP and IMR

bulletPoints.text: Analysing data from 1960 to 2020 and discover patterns in the data that show trends between Gross domestic product per capita, Infant Mortality rate, Literacy Rate, and Industrial Development.
Study cross‑sectional, longitudinal, and among various countries to find variations in trends and get the historical data to back up the change in the trend of our data.
Specific case studies were traced back to trends seen in the UK and how they affected the GDP and IMR.
Tableau, Overleaf, LaTeX.
Time Management, Teamwork, Presentation skills, Report writing.
Analysing data from 2008 to 2015 to discover patterns such as trends, correlations, and probabilities.
Finding the differences between the best teams and players in various fields, as well as their performance on the field and the opponents.
Python with Pandas, matplotlib, Seaborn.
Presentation skills, Leadership, Teamwork, Logical Thinking.

projects.title: Study of the behavior of Serial Killers

bulletPoints.text: Study of serial killers behavior with various motives such as convenience (did not want children or spouse), enjoyment, power, escape, or avoiding arrest.
Finding the differences between the best teams and players in various fields, as well as their performance on the field and the opponents.
R with ggplot2, tidyr, R Markdown.
Report writing, Logical Thinking, Critical Thinking.
